ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is a reminder to the people with taqwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is really a reminder for those who fear God and follow the straight path.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Surely it is a Good Counsel for the God-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Quran is certainly a reminder for the pious ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed this Qur’an is an advice for the pious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And verily, this is a Reminder for those who have Taqwa.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And most surely it is a reminder for those who guard (against evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely it is a Reminder to the godfearing;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And lo! it is a warrant unto those who ward off (evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: And surely it is an admonition to the God-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And verily it is an Admonition Unto the God-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed it is a reminder for the Godwary.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But verily this is a Message for the Allah-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And verily, this Quran is a Reminder for the Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, it is a Reminder to those who fear Allah,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Surely, it is a message for the righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:48] And assuredly it, that is, the Qur’ān, is a reminder for the God-fearing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And lo! It) i.e. the Qur'an (is a warrant) a reminder (unto those who ward off (evil)) disbelief, idolatry and indecencies.
